result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew T Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew T Jordan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew T Jordan was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Obtain GED/HSED.
Maintain employment of at least 30 hours per week.
No driving without a valid driver's license.

Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.
Provide any prescriptions to agent before filling them.

Pay a fine of $300.00;
Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, and fines during period of probation. Court will allow the defendant to enter into a payment plan. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.

If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and fines be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds.

*Court set restitution at ZERO.*

timeConds.notes: FORTHWITH; Defendant may have release for employment if currently employed, release for school if currently enrolled. Defendant may participate in job training.

charges.descr: Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew T Jordan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Andrew T Jordan in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties agree that they have reached resolution in this case.  Pursuant to negotiations, State moved to dismiss Count 2, and to dismiss but read in Count 3.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed and Count 3 dismissed but read in.

AS TO COUNT 01: 
Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.   Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25 and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  The 8/26/15 jury trial date is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial time  changed to 9:00 a.m. per Branch 25's schedule. Parties notified of same.

Defense Witness List, received and filed with:
 - Jury Instructions Requested by Defense.

Defendant Andrew T Jordan in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  State's motion for adjournment was heard; State has not yet received medical records.  Defense counsel did not object; requested that negotiations remain open; State in agreement with same.  Court granted State's motion and vacated the 5/26/15 trial date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this case will be transferred to Judge Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.
State's Motion in Limine filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
State's Witness List filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
State's Requested Jury Instructions filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant Andrew T Jordan in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date.   Any motions to be filed must be filed on or before 4/14/15; response due by 5/04/15; reply due by 5/11/15.  All jury instructions, witness lists and motions in limine are to be filed with the court one (1) week prior to the final pretrial date.  Alibi notices (if any) must be filed according to statute.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew T Jordan in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Plea hearing in court.

Defendant Andrew T Jordan in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision of Jeremy Arn for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew T Jordan
Current: 4112 N. 64th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 02-13-2015)
Prior: 4112 N. 64th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Andrew T Jordan in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
